DragonPath.title: Kobold Warren - collapsed tunnel
DragonPath.description:
The tunnel here is littered with shattered wooden beams, mixed in with the rubble of stone, and a careful look shows some telltale tool marks on the fallen rock as well. It rather gives the impression that the cavein was intentional, like someone didn't want your home connected with this area.

But that was then, and this is now. Your will has opened this path for your own purposes. To the northwest, your cave yawns open in all its glory, your mother's immense skeleton framed by the opening.

To the east, the tunnel continues to a torchlit fork, from which it can be seen going north and south.
DragonPath.preview: The tunnel there connects the Dragonbone Cave to the carved out tunnels beyond.

Bend.title: Kobold Warren - rough hewn tunnel
Bend.description: You've come to a bend in the tunnels, a blind corner that makes it all the more likely to stumble into someone unexpectedly, or a great place to setup an ambush.
Bend.preview: The hewn tunnels bend there, making a good spot to lay an ambush, or get caught in one.

HewnTunnel.title: Kobold Warren - rough hewn tunnel
HewnTunnel.description: You're in a long, straight segment of the tunnels, lined with wooden support beams along the way to increase stability and prevent caveins. It's clear this place was intentionally made, but less clear there was any intent in the layout. Corners and forks abound, and the lighting is quite dim, making you glad dragons see so well in the dark.
HewnTunnel.preview: The tunnel continues straight for some time, supported by periodic wooden support beams.

Torchfork.title: Kobold Warren - torchlit fork
Torchfork.description: The tunnels connect here, creating a T-shaped fork, with a torch embedded in the wall on the long side, illuminating the area slightly.
Torchfork.preview: The tunnel is lit here by a flaming torch in the wall, highlighting the presence of a fork in the tunnel.

Darkfork.title: Kobold Warren - darkened fork
Darkfork.description: The tunnels connect here, creating a T-shaped fork. Distant torchlight keeps the place from total darkness, but no one has lit this intersection, and you nearly missed the fact that there's a fork here at all.
Darkfork.preview: The tunnel continues straight for some time, supported by periodic wooden support beams.

DeadEnd.title: Kobold Warren - dead end
DeadEnd.description:
You come to the end of the tunnel, where there are a few tools discarded. The tunnelling process is apparently ongoing here, and you can see the gleam of copper veins in the walls, still in the process of being excavated.
Dragons aren't well suited to tool use, but they are well suited to enslaving less species to use tools for them. Your mind immediately jumps to the idea of all the things that could be made from the metal here: coins, weapons, coins, armor, coins, art pieces, even coins.
DeadEnd.preview: The tunnel comes to a haphazard end.

BrokenDoor.title: Kobold Jail - broken door
BrokenDoor.description:
You've arrived at an old wooden door, faded with time despite the lack of weather down here. It has a window near the top with copper bars, and you can smell foul odors from beyond.

The door has a nice looking lock that currently serves no purpose, as the door's hinges have been destroyed, and the door is merely propped in place.
BrokenDoor.preview: You see an old wooden door with a small set of copper bars set into a window. The hinges are destroyed, and the door propped up awkwardly.

CellHall.title: Kobold Jail - hallway
CellHall.description: The hallway here is lined with copper-barred cells. The dungeon here is ill maintained and falling apart. The doors still seem to work but the locks are all busted.
CellHall.preview: There is a hallway there, lined with prison cells.

EmptyCell.title: Kobold Jail - empty cell
EmptyCell.description: This cell hasn't been used in quite some time. It's still literred with bits of bone, but the worthless kind not awesome dragon bones.

EastCell.title: Kobold Jail - empty cell
EastCell.description: This cell hasn't been used in quite some time. It's still literred with bits of bone, but the worthless kind not awesome dragon bones.

JackCell.title: Kobold Jail - Lycan's cell
JackCell.description:
The wolf looks up as you enter. His keen, intelligent eyes lock with yours, though you see only the faintest glimmer of hope behind them.

"Dragon," he greets, with as much dignity as he can manage while half-starved and stuck sitting in his own filth.
JackCell.preview: The cell there is occupied by a wolf man, chained to the wall by a thick metal collar locked around his neck. He acknowledges your presence only by pointing an ear your way.

details.text: A dart flies out from the wall suddenly, then glitches out of existence because Istaran hasn't implemented traps yet. Whew. Next time you might not be so lucky.

The torch suddenly flares with arcane energy and its flames suddenly expand, engulfing you in fire! Fortunately for you, you're a red dragon and this actually just feels really nice. You'd probably hate it if you weren't a red dragon.

You come across a miner holding a copper spike attacked to the end of a wooden bar. They jump in surprise, shouldering the tool and looking at you warily, but make no move to initiate a fight. They're obviously waiting on you to make the first move.
details.name: encounter miner

ambush.help: Lie in wait for someone to come around the corner.
